CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Taking advantage of this aggregation control approach , high - performance PSCs based on PffBT4T-2OD:PC71BM were fabricated affording a PCE of up to 10.8% .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. PSCs (Polycrystalline Silicon)
2. PffBT4T-2OD (a specific type of polymer)
3. PC71BM (a specific type of material)

So, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are:

1. PSCs
2. PffBT4T-2OD
3. PC71BM
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! My apologies for the confusion earlier. Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph:

1. PSCs
2. PC71BM

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSCs |
| PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Taking advantage of this aggregation control approach , high - performance PSCs based on PffBT4T-2OD:PC71BM were fabricated affording a PCE of up to 10.8% .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. PSCs (Photovoltaic Cells)
2. PffBT4T-2OD (Polymer Material)
3. PC71BM (Polymer Material)
4. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure! Here are the entities in the paragraph that refer to Material Property:

1. PffBT4T-2OD
2. PC71BM

These are the only entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to Material Property.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to Material Property, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PffBT4T-2OD |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Taking advantage of this aggregation control approach , high - performance PSCs based on PffBT4T-2OD:PC71BM were fabricated affording a PCE of up to 10.8% .

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

1. "PCE" - Percentage of Conversion Efficiency, which is a measure of the device's ability to convert light into electrical energy.
2. "10.8%" - The specific value of the PCE, which is 10.8% in this case.

Therefore, the two "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PCE (Percentage of Conversion Efficiency)
2. 10.8% (the specific value of the PCE)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, I apologize for the confusion earlier. Based on your latest clarification, here are the entities that refer to the "Value of Material Property" in the given paragraph:

1. "PCE" - Percentage of Conversion Efficiency, which refers to the value of the material property of the device's ability to convert light into electrical energy.

Therefore, the only entity that refers to the "Value of Material Property" in the paragraph is:

1. PCE (Percentage of Conversion Efficiency)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to the "Value of Material Property", presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE (Percentage of Conversion Efficiency) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
